title: Annan stresses full implementation of 6-point plan
description: GENEVA， May 29 (Xinhua) -- UN-Arab League joint special envoy Kofi Annan stressed to Syrian President Bashar al-Assad on Tuesday morning the importance of full implementation of the six-point plan， said Ahmad Fawzi， the spokesman for Annan.
cleanContent: GENEVA, May 29 (Xinhua) -- UN-Arab League joint special envoy Kofi Annan stressed to Syrian President Bashar al-Assad on Tuesday morning the importance of full implementation of the six-point plan, said Ahmad Fawzi, the spokesman for Annan.In a statement, Fawzi said that Annan met Assad to convey "the grave concern" of the international community about the violence in Syria, including the recent events in Houleh.Annan told Assad "in frank terms" that the six-point plan cannot succeed without bold steps to stop the violence and release detainees, said Fawzi.Meanwhile, the Syrian deputy foreign minister, Faisal Mikddad, reiterated Syria's resolution and readiness on Tuesday to implement the UN-backed six-point peace plan brokered by Annan, accusing the opposition of being unwilling to abide by the plan which was meant to bring the 15-month unrest in Syria to a close.Talking to reporters, Mikddad said that Syria has not violated Annan's plan that calls for a cease-fire from all parties.Fawzi said that Annan will speak to the press later on Tuesday.Related:																																																																								|  |
